verses.verse: Oh that <S%H5414><s%> thou wert as my brother <S%H251><s%>, That sucked <S%H3243><s%> the breasts <S%H7699><s%> of my mother <S%H517><s%>! When I should find <S%H4672><s%> thee without <S%H2351><s%>, I would kiss <S%H5401><s%> thee <S%H936><s%>; Yea, and none would despise me.

I would lead <S%H5090><s%> thee <S%H935><s%>, and bring thee into my mother <S%H517><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, Who would instruct <S%H3925><s%> me <S%H8248><s%>; I would cause thee to drink of spiced <S%H7544><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%>, Of the juice <S%H6071><s%> of my pomegranate <S%H7416><s%>.
His left hand <S%H8040><s%> should be under my head <S%H7218><s%>, And his right hand <S%H3225><s%> should embrace me <S%H2263><s%>.
I adjure <S%H7650><s%> you <S%H1323><s%>, O daughters of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, That ye stir not up <S%H5782><s%>, nor awake <S%H5782><s%> my love <S%H160><s%>, Until he please <S%H2654><s%>.

Who is this that cometh up <S%H5927><s%> from the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, Leaning <S%H7514><s%> upon her beloved <S%H1730><s%>? Under the apple-tree <S%H8598><s%> I awakened <S%H5782><s%> thee <S%H517><s%>: There thy mother was in travail <S%H2254><s%> with thee <S%H3205><s%>, There was she in travail that brought thee forth <S%H2254><s%>.

Set <S%H7760><s%> me as a seal <S%H2368><s%> upon thy heart <S%H3820><s%>, As a seal <S%H2368><s%> upon thine arm <S%H2220><s%>: For love <S%H160><s%> is strong <S%H5794><s%> as death <S%H4194><s%>; Jealousy <S%H7068><s%> is cruel <S%H7186><s%> as Sheol <S%H7585><s%>; The flashes <S%H7565><s%> thereof are flashes <S%H7565><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%>, A very flame of Jehovah <S%H7957><s%>.

Many <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> cannot <S%H3201><s%> quench <S%H3518><s%> love <S%H160><s%>, Neither can floods <S%H5104><s%> drown <S%H7857><s%> it <S%H376><s%>: If a man would give <S%H5414><s%> all the substance <S%H1952><s%> of his house <S%H1004><s%> for love <S%H160><s%>, He would utterly <S%H936><s%> be contemned <S%H936><s%>.

We have a little <S%H6996><s%> sister <S%H269><s%>, And she hath no breasts <S%H7699><s%>: What shall we do <S%H6213><s%> for our sister <S%H269><s%> In the day <S%H3117><s%> when she shall be spoken for <S%H1696><s%>?

If she be a wall <S%H2346><s%>, We will build <S%H1129><s%> upon her a turret <S%H2918><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>: And if she be a door <S%H1817><s%>, We will inclose <S%H6696><s%> her with boards <S%H3871><s%> of cedar <S%H730><s%>.
I am a wall <S%H2346><s%>, and my breasts <S%H7699><s%> like the towers <S%H4026><s%> thereof Then was I in his eyes <S%H5869><s%> as one that found <S%H4672><s%> peace <S%H7965><s%>.

Solomon <S%H8010><s%> had a vineyard <S%H3754><s%> at Baal-hamon <S%H1174><s%>; He let out <S%H5414><s%> the vineyard <S%H3754><s%> unto keepers <S%H5201><s%>; Every one <S%H376><s%> for the fruit <S%H6529><s%> thereof was to bring <S%H935><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> pieces of silver <S%H3701><s%>.

My vineyard <S%H3754><s%>, which is mine <S%H6440><s%>, is before me <S%H8010><s%>: Thou, O Solomon, shalt have the thousand <S%H505><s%>, And those that keep <S%H5201><s%> the fruit <S%H6529><s%> thereof two hundred <S%H3967><s%>.
Thou that dwellest <S%H3427><s%> in the gardens <S%H1588><s%>, The companions <S%H2270><s%> hearken <S%H7181><s%> for thy voice <S%H6963><s%>: Cause me to hear it <S%H8085><s%>. of Solomon

Make haste <S%H1272><s%>, my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, And be thou like <S%H1819><s%> to a roe <S%H6643><s%> or to a young <S%H6082><s%> hart <S%H354><s%> Upon the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of spices <S%H1314><s%>.
